title: 107_s1134
content: The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as the repeal of minimum tax preference, an increase in the rollover period for qualified small business stock from 60 days to 180 days, and a reduction in the holding period for gains from certain small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments like reducing the holding period for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years, repealing the per-issuer limitation on eligible gain, and modifying the definition of qualified trade or business in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as extending the holding period for gains from certain small business stock to 5 years and providing exceptions to redemption rules for purchases with a business purpose. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock from 50% to 100% in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Conforming amendments were made to sections 1(h)(5) and 1(h)(9) of the Code. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" amends section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100%. Conforming amendments were made to various sections of the Code. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" increases the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100% and allows stock of larger businesses to be eligible for exclusion by amending section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" amends section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include an inflation adjustment for the asset limitation of qualified small businesses. The $300,000,000 amount in paragraph (1) is increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10,000, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10,000. The amendments made by the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" apply to stock issued after the enactment date of the Act.
